publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1156# Tavish Scott: Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management-That the Parliament recognises the importance to Shetland of its fishing industry which supports vital employment in the fish catching, processing and ancillary sectors; notes that to provide a stable future a complete review of fisheries conservation and management policies is urgently needed, and commends to the Scottish Executive the proposals for zonal management put forward by the Scottish Fishermen's Federation.

S1M-1156# Tavish Scott: Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management-That the Parliament recognises the importance to Shetland of its fishing industry which supports vital employment in the fish catching, processing and ancillary sectors; notes that to provide a stable future a complete review of fisheries conservation and management policies is urgently needed, and commends to the Scottish Executive the proposals for zonal management put forward by the Scottish Fishermen's Federation.
S1M-1156# Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management (lodged on 7 September 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-1156# Tavish Scott: Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management-That the Parliament recognises the importance to Shetland of its fishing industry which supports vital employment in the fish catching, processing and ancillary sectors; notes that to provide a stable future a complete review of fisheries conservation and management policies is urgently needed, and commends to the Scottish Executive the proposals for zonal management put forward by the Scottish Fishermen's Federation. Supported by: Donald Gorrie

S1M-1156# Tavish Scott: Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management—That the Parliament recognises the importance to Shetland of its fishing industry which supports vital employment in the fish catching, processing and ancillary sectors; notes that to provide a stable future a complete review of fisheries conservation and management policies is urgently needed, and commends to the Scottish Executive the proposals for zonal management put forward by the Scottish Fishermen’s Federation. Supported by: Donald Gorrie
S1M-1156# Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management (lodged on 7 September 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Euan Robson*

S1M-1156# Tavish Scott: Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management—That the Parliament recognises the importance to Shetland of its fishing industry which supports vital employment in the fish catching, processing and ancillary sectors; notes that to provide a stable future a complete review of fisheries conservation and management policies is urgently needed, and commends to the Scottish Executive the proposals for zonal management put forward by the Scottish Fishermen’s Federation. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Euan Robson
S1M-1156# Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management (lodged on 7 September 2000) Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-1156# Tavish Scott: Common Fisheries Policy Reform and Zonal Management—That the Parliament recognises the importance to Shetland of its fishing industry which supports vital employment in the fish catching, processing and ancillary sectors; notes that to provide a stable future a complete review of fisheries conservation and management policies is urgently needed, and commends to the Scottish Executive the proposals for zonal management put forward by the Scottish Fishermen’s Federation. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Euan Robson, Mr Jamie Stone

Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Euan Robson, Mr Jamie Stone
